items.text: length outside off, punched towards cover for a quick single, Taylor was a bit late to start off but makes it easily in the end

items.preText:
Jahangir Alam: "At last,our khan has hammered."

Saadat Saquib: "Bangladesh coach was saying about Saifuddin to be next Mashrafe. Today we saw his batting and he seems to be more than capable. But he needs to prove as a bowler. This series is the biggest chance to prove himself and emerge as a long-awaited-bangladeshi pace bowler-allrounder."

items.text: nice flight, lands it outside off, driven with the spin to long-off.
items.shortText: Nazmul Islam to Taylor, 1 run

items.text: extra bounce, he makes room and bunts this into the gap at cover.
items.shortText: Nazmul Islam to Masakadza, 1 run

items.text: beauty of a delivery and he brings out the snake dance. Taylor is gone and this is a body blow for Zimbabwe. Lovely, lovely delivery. Got this to drift in from round the stumps, drew Taylor forward but he made the grave mistake of feeling for the delivery without covering the line. Played inside the line as a result and saw the ball deviate just a wee bit to beat the outside edge and crash into the stumps. As a left-arm spinner, you can't bowl a better delivery. Bangladesh are on top with that wicket. Superb from Nazmul, that would've made spin bowling coach Sunil Joshi mighty proud.
items.shortText: Nazmul Islam to Taylor, OUT

dismissal.text: BRM Taylor  b Nazmul Islam 5 (13b 0x4 0x6) SR: 38.46
